newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Trans Hex finds diamonds in Central Africa.
newsitem.headline: Trans Hex finds diamonds in Central Africa.

text.p: United Reef Ltd and Trans Hex International Ltd announced on Tuesday they had discovered diamond-bearing gravels in the Central African Republic (CAR).

In a joint statement the two Canadian companies said their trenching programme had made the find along the left bank of CAR's Bangoran river, eight km north of their 30 tonne per hour processing plant at Bamingui Diamond Property.

Three of the five trenches had uncovered stones, with the second and third trenches proving average recovery grades of 6.03 carats per 100 tonnes and 4.96 carats per 100 tonnes respectively. Trenches four and five were still in progress.

The statement said that management expected the Bangoran diamonds to have an average value similar to that received for diamonds from the Bamingui deposit, which has produced stones with an average sales value of US$188 per carat.
Only 1.5 km of the Bangoran river's 9.5 km length has been tested for diamonds. Additional bulk samples will be tested over the coming months, the companies said.
